citation.article-title: Anaerobiospirillum thomasii sp. nov., an anaerobic spiral bacterium isolated from the feces of cats and dogs and from diarrheal feces of humans, and emendation of the genus Anaerobiospirillum.

p.s: Description of Anaerobiospirillum thomasii sp. nov.

Anaerobiospirillum thomasii (thom'as.i.i. N. L. gen. n. thomasii, of Thomas, named after M. E. M. Thomas [Public Health Laboratory Service, 1947 to 19841, whose interest in and enthusiasm for uncommon medical bacterial infections led to the initiation of this study)
Cells are gram-negative helical rods (0.5 to 0.7 by 5 to 32 μm).
Flagella are arranged in bipolar tufts.
Growth occurs at temperatures between 33 and 43°C; the optimal temperature is 37°C.
Flat colonies with even, sometimes spreading edges are 1 to 2 mm in diameter after 24 to 48 h on horse blood agar.
Acid is produced from adonitol, galactose, glucose, and maltose.
Acid is not produced from cellobiose, fructose, inulin, lactose, mannitol, raffinose, salicin, sorbitol, sucrose, and trehalose.
The following tests are negative: catalase, oxidase, nitrate reduction, and hydrolysis of esculin, hippurate, and urea.
The enzymes detected with an API ZYM kit are leucine arylamidase and N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase.

The enzymes not detected with an API ZYM kit include acid and alkaline phosphatases, esterase (C-4), esterase-lipase (C-8), lipase (C-14), valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, trypsin, chymotrypsin, phosphohydrolase, α-D-galactosidase, β-D-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, α-mannosidase, and α-fucosidase.
The major products of glucose metabolism are succinic acid and acetic acid.
The G+C content of the DNA is 39 to 42 mol%.
Isolated from cat and dog feces and as a pathogen in human diarrheal feces.
The type strain is strain NCTC 12467.
